item.title: @elonmusk: ELON MUSK: ‚ÄúThe fundamental moral flaw of the left is empathy for the criminals and not empathy for ...
item.description: ELON MUSK: ‚ÄúThe fundamental moral flaw of the left is empathy for the criminals and not empathy for the victims. There's been immense judicial overreach that is unconstitutional. It's undermining the people's faith in the legal system. It needs to stop. It's gone too far."

item.title: @elonmusk: The violent man who slashed an elderly woman across the face with a nail and destroyed her eye after...
item.description: The violent man who slashed an elderly woman across the face with a nail and destroyed her eye after years of being allowed to punch random women in the face without consequence identifies as a woman, according to his defense attorney.

item.title: @elonmusk: This is a brilliant post. Took me about 5 minutes to relax, and about 2 weeks to realize it was bett...
item.description: This is a brilliant post. Took me about 5 minutes to relax, and about 2 weeks to realize it was better than me, something my ego was late to accept. I lost a very good friend in high-school to completely preventable accident. I don't want anyone to make that statement again!

item.title: @elonmusk: 10 hours into Tesla FSD v14.2.2 and here are my thoughts: Zero lane change hesitation at all. Extrem...
item.description: 10 hours into Tesla FSD v14.2.2 and here are my thoughts: Zero lane change hesitation at all. Extremely refined, excellent lane choices and some parking improvements are a few things to note. Really stoked about the lane changes on this build. There is ZERO lane indecisiveness, no hesitation, no stuttering. Nothing. I had never really seen much before, but this build you can tell its decision making process is much quicker and it commits. Mad Max mode is definitely mad again and I love it. Seems even quicker than v14.2.1.25 which was an improvement, but the lane changes + choices are better now. Hurry mode seems quicker on the highways and larger roads than before and very close to Mad Max, it was perfect before on v14.2.1.25. The new addition on the release notes for arrival pin being adjusted based on arrival option works. It changes the route based on if you‚Äôre going curbside, or to the lot or street parking. It behaved that way before usually but now it‚Äôs visualized. Parking is improved and impressive this build. Every single spot I parked in, it performed excellent. Centered in the lines, quick one and done parking jobs and they were great, improvement over early v14.2 builds. In parking garages, it now pulls up exactly at the ticket dispenser where in earlier v14.2 builds it would stop 9 inches short like I mentioned in previous v14.2+ build reviews. That‚Äôs fixed and worked great- couldn‚Äôt have asked for it to be any better. Perfect distance and approach- will do a lot more of this testing tomorrow. Canyon roads were insanely impressive. Did the snake 3 times which is a super narrow and twisty road and each time it performed great. Speeds were good, took the proper lines and even accelerated out of corners very well. These were all in the dark too very late at night- will post some more videos of it. Stop and go traffic performance in rush hour was awesome as before, with some added notes for how well it waited to enter an intersection if there was stopped traffic on the other side. It waited 3/3 lights I encountered where if it went and the light changed, it would be sticking into traffic so it didn‚Äôt go. Exactly like a human wouldn‚Äôt but the car judged it better than I did. One time it creeped a bit slow, but other than that fine since. Saw one instance of red hands but before I could react, it had already recovered itself. Still so impressed with how well it handles lane splitting motorcycles. It sees them approaching before I even do, and moves over just enough to be courteous to the rider as well as the car or shoulder next to me. Nice touch, and glad to see it perform well. One thing I noticed is how smooth its steering inputs always are. It just takes corners with such precision and smoothness that no human could ever come close to it. Especially noticeable on twisty roads- it drives better than almost every human on them. And I encountered a power outage tonight and the car still drove perfectly even with pitch black around. Overall, loving what I‚Äôm seeing with this build. Will report back in the day time with more but I am going to head home to get some sleep. Another huge thank you to all the magicians@Tesla_AIfor working so hard during the holiday season to get these updates out.

item.title: @elonmusk: What is@grok? It is deep empathy! From Heinlein‚Äôs Stranger in a Strange Land: Grok means "identicall...
item.description: What is@grok? It is deep empathy! From Heinlein‚Äôs Stranger in a Strange Land: Grok means "identically equal". The human clich√© "This hurts me worse than it does you" has a distinctly Martian flavor. The Martian seems to know instinctively what we learned painfully from modern physics, that observer acts with observed through the process of observation. Grokmeans to understand so thoroughly that the observer becomes a part of the observed ‚Äî to merge, blend, intermarry, lose identity in group experience. It means almost everything that we mean by religion, philosophy, and science and it means as little to us as color does to a blind man.
